segment.source: This security setting determines if a user who is logged on locally to a device can shut down Windows.
segment.target: This security setting determines if a user who is logged on locally to a device can shut down Windows.

segment.source: Shutting down domain controllers makes them unavailable to perform functions such as processing logon requests, processing Group Policy settings, and answering Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) queries.
segment.target: Shutting down domain controllers makes them unavailable to perform functions such as processing logon requests, processing Group Policy settings, and answering Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) queries.

segment.source: Shutting down domain controllers that have been assigned operations master roles (also known as flexible single master operations or FSMO roles) can disable key domain functionality; for example, processing logon requests for new passwords, which is performed by the primary domain controller (PDC) emulator master.
segment.target: Shutting down domain controllers that have been assigned operations master roles (also known as flexible single master operations or FSMO roles) can disable key domain functionality; for example, processing logon requests for new passwords, which is performed by the primary domain controller (PDC) emulator master.

segment.source: The Shut down the system user right is required to enable hibernation support, to set the power management settings, and to cancela shutdown.
segment.target: The Shut down the system user right is required to enable hibernation support, to set the power management settings, and to cancela shutdown.

segment.source: Ensure that only Administrators and Backup Operators have the Shut down the system user right on member servers, and that only Administrators have the user right on domain controllers.
segment.target: Ensure that only Administrators and Backup Operators have the Shut down the system user right on member servers, and that only Administrators have the user right on domain controllers.

segment.source: The ability to shut down domain controllers should be limited to a very small number of trusted administrators.
segment.target: The ability to shut down domain controllers should be limited to a very small number of trusted administrators.

segment.source: Even though a system shutdown requires the ability to log on to the server, you should be very careful about the accounts and groups that you allow to shut down a domain controller.
